name: Chef Publis's Devilled Prawns with Tomato
author: Rick Stein
ingredients:
- 20 large raw peeled prawns
- 1/4 tsp turmeric
- 450g ripe vine tomatoes
- 60ml coconut or vegetable oil
- 75g shallots or onions, thinly sliced
- 15g garlic, finely chopped
- 15g peeled ginger, finely chopped
- 5x1cm pieces pandan leaf
- 20 curry leaves
- 1 tsp crushed dried chillies
- 10cm cinnamon stick, broken
- 1 green cayenne chilli, thinly sliced
- 100g white of leek, sliced on the diagonal
- 1/2 tsp freshly ground black pepper
- 100g green pepper, deseeded and sliced
- Juice of 1 lime
- Small handful of fresh mint leaves
instructions:
- Toss the prawns with the turmeric and 1/2 tsp salt. Set aside. Finely chop half the tomatoes and cut the reset into wedges. Set aside.
- Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the onions or shallots and fry for 5 minutes until soft and translucent.
- Add the garlic, ginger, pandan leaf and curry leaves and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the crushed chillies and cinnamon and fry for another 2 minutes, until the mixture smells aromatic.
- Add the finely chopped tomatoes, green chilli, leek, black pepper and 1 tsp salt and stir-fry for 5 minutes.
- Add the prawns, green pepper and tomato wedges and cook for another 5 minutes until the prawns are cooked. Stir in the lime juice and mint leaves, and serve with rice.
